info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 4:16PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Pecos, eastern Reeves, eastern Ward and southwestern Crane Counties through 500 PM CDT... At 416 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pyote, or 15 miles southwest of Monahans, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monahans, Thorntonville, Grandfalls, Pyote, Wickett, Royalty, Roy Hurd Memorial Airport, Monahans Sandhills State Park and Imperial. This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 66 and 88. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
